item.title: The Wilcoxon Rank Sum Test
item.description: The Wilcoxon Rank Sum Test is often described as the non-parametric version of the two-sample t-test. You sometimes see it in analysis flowcharts after a question such as “is your data normal?” A “no” branch off this question will recommend a Wilcoxon test if you’re comparing two groups of continuous measures. So what is this Wilcoxon test? What makes it non-parametric? What does that even mean? And how do we implement it and interpret it?
